dcterms:creator: G. Muñoz-Gil
G. Volpe
M. A. Garcia-March
R. Metzler
M. Lewenstein
C. Manzo
dcterms:description: The AnDi database is used for the Anomalous Diffusion Challenge, which aims to assess and compare new approaches for single trajectory characterization, focusing on the inference of the anomalous diffusion exponent, classification of the diffusion model, and segmentation of trajectories.
dcterms:title: AnDi database

dcterms:creator: G. Muñoz-Gil
C. Manzo
G. Volpe
M. A. Garcia-March
R. Metzler
M. Lewenstein
dcterms:description: The andi-dataset is an open-source Python package used to generate simulated trajectories based on theoretical models of anomalous diffusion, including noise to mimic real experimental data.
dcterms:title: andi-dataset
